body:
Files with back slash should definitely work.

If you are transferring via crypt then the WebDAV server won't even see the backslashes if you are using filename encryption.

Are you using filename encryption?

Can you store a file with a backslash on owncloud via the web interface?

I thought there were files with backslash in in the integration tests but apparently not!

nope, no filename encryption, just content.

I'll do some test with storing backslash files on the webdav server by hand

They do seem to be running an old OwnCloud instance: 

```json
{
    "installed": true,
    "maintenance": false,
    "version": "8.2.20",
    "versionstring": "8.2.20",
    "edition": ""
}
```

if i would sync from google drive encrypt to webdav encrypt, rclone says "....is a file and not a Directory"

what can i do?

Command:
rclone sync "remote-1:Folder\Folder" "remote-2:Folder\Folder"

I tried copying a file with a `\` to owncloud and nextcloud and they both gave this error

    2018/11/03 17:48:36 ERROR : file\with-slash: Failed to copy: File name contains at least one invalid character: OCA\DAV\Connector\Sabre\Exception\InvalidPath: 400 Bad Request

I also tried it copying to a crypt on nextcloud with file name encryption off with the same result.

So...
1. I don't think you can have files with `\` on owncloud/nextcloud
2. I don't understand the hanging you saw unless it was running through all the files with \ on the retry.
    - did the sync finish in the end?

Agreed, it's not allowed to have a `\` on owncloud. The hang I got (consistently after multiple times of getting the filter definition right) really stopped all work, the sync never finished.

As I said, i hope I get some time to construct a tar with the specific directory.

okay, sorry for the long wait. I constructed a tar: [break-rclone.tar.gz](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/files/2605607/break-rclone.tar.gz)


extract that archive, and try to sync that from the root.

I can't get it to hang.  I tried it against owncloud and next cloud...

https://github.com/ncw/rclone/blob/50452207d912447197c149cb3aa96ae7c26ef838/backend/webdav/webdav.go#L629-L635

Can you run with `-vv --dump responses --log-file rclone.log`.  CTRL-C when it gets stuck and attach the log - thanks :-)
